definition: lit. the iron tree blooms (idiom)/a highly improbable or extremely rare occurrence

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: We saw the meteors flew past, saw the sago cycads flowered .
sentences.chinese: 我们看见流星飞过，看铁树开花。

sentences.english: Title The utilization of Cycas and its bloom.
sentences.chinese: 铁树开花与苏铁之利用。

definition: lit. the spring comes upon a withered tree (idiom)/fig. to get a new lease on life/to be revived/(of a difficult situation) to suddenly improve
to bloom/to blossom/to flower/fig. to burst open/to feel happy or elated/new development grows out
(bird species of China) Eurasian magpie (Pica pica)
two simultaneous happy events in the family
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
when the melon is ripe, it falls (idiom); problems sort themselves out in the fullness of time
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
hearts linked as one, just as the proverbial rhinoceros communicates emotion telepathically through his single horn (idiom); fig. two hearts beat as one
